visast package¶

Submodules¶

visast.generate module¶

generator.py Generates an Abstract Syntax Tree

VisAST - Building and visualising Abstract Syntax Trees for Python code.

Authors: Jesse Phillips <james@jamesphillipsuk.com>

visast.generate.fromPath(path: str) → AST¶

This method, given a python file’s path, generates an abstract syntax tree for it.

Parameters:

path (string) – The filepath.

Returns:

The abstract syntax tree.

Return type:

AST

visast.generate.fromString(codeString: str) → AST¶

This method, given a string of Python, generates an abstract syntax tree for it.

Parameters:

codeString (string) – The code to analyse.

Returns:

The abstract syntax tree.

Return type:

AST

visast.generate.fromURL(uRL: str) → AST¶

This method, given a python file’s URL, generates an abstract syntax tree for it.

Parameters:

uRL (string) – The URL.

Returns:

The abstract syntax tree.

Return type:

AST

visast.visualise module¶

visualise.py Visualises an Abstract Syntax Tree

VisAST - Building and visualising Abstract Syntax Trees for Python code.

Authors: Jesse Phillips <james@jamesphillipsuk.com>

visast.visualise.graph(aST: <module 'ast' from '/usr/lib/python3.10/ast.py'>) → None¶

Builds a visualisation of the provided AST.

Parameters:

aST (AST) – The abstract syntax tree.
